definition: pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: And that might explain why the pitch of their songs has gotten lower.
sentences.chinese: 这也是它们歌声音调变低的原因。

sentences.english: Therefore Pleiadian and Orion tones of creation are poisonous unto earth.
sentences.chinese: 因此昂宿星和猎户座的造物音调对地球是有毒的。

sentences.english: Seriously, a good pitch, hold your breath read out.
sentences.chinese: 认真地发好每一个音调，屏住呼吸读出。

sentences.english: Stagehands are in charge of tuning the instruments for the musicians.
sentences.chinese: 舞台工作人员负责帮音乐家们调乐器的音调。

sentences.english: The singer's high notes grated on the ears of her listeners.
sentences.chinese: 这位女歌唱家的高音调使听众感到刺耳。

sentences.english: When I twirl this around, it produces a particular tone.
sentences.chinese: 当我把这个旋转，它发出特殊的音调。

sentences.english: The oboe and cello sat alone , echoing tone for tone.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管和大提琴双重奏，音调此起彼伏。

sentences.english: An optimal design method for the prototype filter design of the filtered multitone modulation system is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 给出了滤波多音调制系统的原型滤波器优化设计方法。

sentences.english: I am often struck by new phrases that are profoundly meaningful and melodic.
sentences.chinese: 一些意义深远，音调优美的词组经常触动着我。

sentences.english: I'm going to play this song in a lower key.
sentences.chinese: 我将以低音调弹奏这首歌曲。

sentences.english: The lavender tones of absolute love will assist in this goal.
sentences.chinese: 绝对爱的淡紫音调，将帮助获得这个目标。

sentences.english: How do you produce this kind of tone and vibrato?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎样发出这种音调和振音的？

sentences.english: Yellow Calcite is holding the breath of life tone in the Language of Light.
sentences.chinese: 黄色方解石持有光之语中生命呼吸的音调。

sentences.english: Reporters for radio and television must be attuned to the sound of the words they use.
sentences.chinese: 广播电视记者必须注重字词的音节音调。

sentences.english: Music raised in pitch by one chromatic semitone .
Aventurine holds the tone of compassion along with all tones that are blue-green within the Language of Light.
sentences.chinese: 砂金石掌握同情音调和光之语内所有蓝绿音调。

definition: tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
final sound of a syllable/rhyme (e.g. in European languages)
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
diction/enunciation/to pronounce the words correctly (in opera)
